titleStmt.title: The distressed mother: being a merchants daughter of London, who lost her husband in Ireland, and her father falling to decay, b[eing] in prison, brought her youngest child to the court at Kensington, leaving it there with a note in its bosome, wh[ich] show'd her misfortunes; desiring the Queen to be kind to the child for its parents sake; which she graciously [ac]cordingly did. To the tune of, Let Cesar live long.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby, J. Deacon, J. Blare, J. Back.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "All you that have now a desire to hear ..."
Cf. Wing D1704 which has "daughter of Ireland" in the title.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
